meanings.definition: A ritual enclosure that allows Jews to carry objects in public on the Sabbath within a certain area.
meanings.sent1: The eruvim in our neighborhood make it easier for us to carry things on Saturdays.
meanings.sent2: The eruvim were set up so the community could freely transport items on the Sabbath.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the eruvim were a fun obstacle course to navigate.
meanings.sent4: The invisible barrier of the eruvim created a sense of unity among the Jewish families.
meanings.sent5: The eruvim acted like a magical force field, allowing movement within its boundaries.
